Html:
I need to run two cameras simultaneously in one application and get data from both cameras. Is this possible?

Under the help file for: CurrentCamera Property it says:

"The camera currently acquiring images, only one camera can be acquiring at one time and its starts acquiring as soon as it is set"

If I created two TouchlessMgr instances like could I have one cam on each instance? for example:

TouchlessMgr _touch1 = new  TouchlessMgr();

TouchlessMgr _touch2 = new  TouchlessMgr();

_touch1.CurrentCamera = _touch1.Cameras[0];

_touch2.CurrentCamera = _touch2.Cameras[1];

or perhaps:

	    Camera c = new Camera();
            Camera d = new Camera();
            c = _touch.Cameras[0];
            d = _touch.Cameras[1];

Nope, sorry. I've wanted this functionality for a while, but have insuficient DirectShow experience. Perhaps sometime soon or with some help...

- Mike

- Mike

I can to send working example how to use two or more cameras simultaneously using DirectShow, if you want.
I use 5 cameras in my C# project now.

Andrew P.

Cool! If you have the rights to redistribute that code, it doesn't use AviCap32, and it doesn't depend on external projects (like DirectShow.NET); please do send it along. It would be great if you could prepare a patch that integrates your project into Touchless by extending or replacing WebCamLib? I could then expose the functionality through TouchlessMgr. Otherwise, e-mail me your project and I'll take a look as I have time. Thanks!

- Mike
Did anything happen with this? Mike, are you working on a new dual cam option?
I'm waiting on Andrew to reply, I'll PM him. I'll be glad to help integrate any viable patches to support this functionality.

HI

i AM DEVELOPING AN APPLICATION IN C# TO CONTROL 3 WEBCAMS.

BUT I CANT CONTROL MORE THAN ONE. CAN ANY ONE SEND THE SOURCE CODE OF HOW TO CONTROL MORE THAN 1 WEBCAM USING TOUCHLESS SDK IT WILL BE VERY USEFULL FOR ME.

REGARDS

MUTHU

- Mike

Hello.
I can send example to you ... but how I can to do this? (to which e-mail or ...)
..see P.S. & P.P.S. below...


- Muthu

I sent example which work with some web cams at one time for you, but I use DirectShow.NET library for this.

Write me if u have some questions.


P.S.: -Mile. This example don't use touchless SDK. It's only example how I use some web cams in my app. You can adapt your SDK (or my example :) ) if you want.

P.P.S.: I think that you can make some compilation of DirectShow.NET library if you don't want to use this library.

Andrew.

Please send the sample to this email id ntumuthu@gmail.com

What do you mean "able to mix two videos captured into one video"?
Example able to read separate samples (frames) from some input devices. And you can to do any processing with this data (filter, mix, write to file, view to screen & etc.)
..you can make your event handler..

Hi,

I have coded a C# WPF app that let you connect Kinects and webcams to take pictures and videos from all sources at the same time. I'm using Touchless to manage the webcams, but I have a rather big problem. Those webcams run 1080p at 30fps and they can't be used asynchronously because TouchlessMgr is monolithic. I have to alternate between cameras by setting the "TouchlessMgr.CurrentCamera" to each one successively while I would need to run them in their own thread with their own TouchlessMgr and Camera handle. Any advice on that would be greatly appreciated. Thank you for your time,

 

Louis

Best regards


Sent

lpbourret wrote:

Hi,

I have coded a C# WPF app that let you connect Kinects and webcams to take pictures and videos from all sources at the same time. I'm using Touchless to manage the webcams, but I have a rather big problem. Those webcams run 1080p at 30fps and they can't be used asynchronously because TouchlessMgr is monolithic. I have to alternate between cameras by setting the "TouchlessMgr.CurrentCamera" to each one successively while I would need to run them in their own thread with their own TouchlessMgr and Camera handle. Any advice on that would be greatly appreciated. Thank you for your time,

 

Louis
